HyperText.name: guidelines
HyperText.value:
• Insert boundary between clauses (never inside) whenever a reasoning step ends — this happens when: (1) semantic type changes, or (2) the current step is complete even if the function stays the same.
• Do not judge correctness — focus on structure; segments must be contiguous, non-overlapping, and cover the entire text.
Semantic types (insert boundary when type changes):
• Context — Text provided before the first generated token (questions, retrieved docs).
• Planning — High-level directions or local specific plans (e.g., 'Let’s simplify').
• Fact — External knowledge (theorems, trivia, constants) not deduced from the problem.
• Reasoning — Deductive/inductive inference, applying facts to rules, or simplifying equations.
• Restatement — Rephrasing preceding text (e.g., 'As seen previously').
• Assumption — Proposing conditions for further reasoning, branching, or proof by contradiction.
• Example — Specific cases used for pattern finding or illustration of general concepts.
• Reflection — Clauses expressing confidence, feelings, impressions, or doubt.
• Conclusion — The final answer emission (typically a single consecutive set).
